ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: As a Vietnamese-American, my vietnamese has been very conversational until taking this class. Professor Quang really helps us get a deeper insight for the language past the traditional speaking vocab that I have learned from speaking with my family. He also makes classes fun and enjoyable to attend.
more conversational vietnamese vocab/speaking, reading/writing vietnamese.
Learned a lot more about Vietnamese writing and reading. Became a much stronger speaker as well.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strength of this course is in the Professor's care for his students. Thy Quang is invested in the project of teaching diaspora students how to speak their language and connecting them with resources to help blossom Vietnamese American community at Yale. A weakness of this course is its lack of organization. Some of my classmates were not submitting paper work on time repeatedly, so there was a switch to Canvas. But the Canvas page is very disorganized and it became really difficult and annoying to submit 15+ page physical homework packets on Canvas, requiring all of the work be photographed and made into a pdf.
I think the grading schedule is a bit confusing and grades are not very accessible for students to check.

Strengths: Immersive learning, multiple activities, great classroom community cultivated
Weaknesses: Poor scheduling/time management, disorganized

you relearn a lot of the same material from L1/L2 with a little more depth. it's good review, but feels repetitive. a lot of the packets feel like busy work, but the classroom setting is pretty engaging. grades/deadlines are confusing but manageable and professor is understanding.

Strengths: Fun and engaging classes, also very collaborative
Weaknesses: Curriculum was a bit disorganized and fast-paced which sometimes did not meet the needs of students

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes if you'd like to continue your Vietnamese studies.
Yes, if you are interested in learning more about vietnamese language and culture I highly recommend this course.
yes, absolutely. work is pretty reasonable and the professor is great - kind and patient.
Yes to develop skill in Vietnamese
